question: my mother is 56 yrs with a history of diabetes & high BP. we did a CT scan of her heart and the results pointed 2 things:1. increased calcium score of 405 (normal range 0-100)2. calcified plaques with high grade stenosis (>90%) involving proximal-mid segment of LADsomeone please explain what this means? i will be seeing a doc by day after!thanks!
title: help for my mum
